Name: Adrián Arroyo Gutiérrez
Notes: Known as "The Southern Psychopath"; raped and strangled drug-addicted sex workers in San José; sentenced to 110 years imprisonment.[313]

Name: Joseph Naso
Notes: A freelance photographers who raped and strangled to death women in California. Arrested in 2011 and sentenced to death two years later. Known as "The Double Initial Killer" since first four victims to be identified bore double initials.[314]

Name: John George Haigh
Notes: Called the "Acid Bath Murderer" for dissolving his victims in sulphuric acid under the belief that he could not be prosecuted for murder if no body was found. He would then forge papers to sell the victims possessions. Confessed nine murders, convicted of six and hanged.

Name: Jack the Stripper
Notes: Murdered at least six sex workers in London and may have been responsible for the deaths of two others before that. Remains unidentified.

Name: Morris Solomon Jr.
Notes: Handyman who killed six young women between 1986 and 1987 in Sacramento, California. Sentenced to death on September 16, 1992.

Name: Mack Ray Edwards
Notes: Molester. Murdered 2 young girls and 4 young boys. Claimed at one point to have killed as many as 18.

Name: Terry Peder Rasmussen
Notes: Known as the "Chameleon Killer"; main suspect in the Bear Brook murders, as well as other murders.[315]

Name: Robert Berdella
Notes: Berdella abducted, raped, tortured, and murdered at least six men.

Name: Juan Chavez
Notes: Murdered six men in Los Angeles County in what he claimed was a retaliation against the AIDS epidemic.[316]

Name: David Berkowitz
Notes: Known as "Son of Sam", he went after young women and couples killing 6 people and wounding 7 others with a .44 caliber Bulldog revolver. He was caught when an eyewitness to his last murder saw he had a parking ticket on his car. He was sentenced to life in prison with parole in 1978.[317]

Name: Richard Chase
Notes: Known as "The Vampire of Sacramento" because he drank his victims' blood and cannibalized their remains. He killed six people in the span of a month in Sacramento, California.[318] The 1987 film Rampage was loosely based on based on Chase's crimes.[319]

Name: Michael Terry
Notes: Murdered six men in Atlanta, Georgia in a 10-month period, via stabbing or shooting. Sentenced to life imprisonment in 1988.[320]

Name: Lázaro Barbosa de Sousa
Notes: Convicted of a double murder in 2007; later escaped from prison and murdered a family of 4 before dying in a shootout with the police.[321]

Name: Alfredo Galán
Notes: Shot random people over the course of three months, killing six and wounding three. He would sometimes leave a Spanish playing card at the scene of the crime as a signature.[322]

Name: Friedrich Schumann
Notes: Killed six people and executed in 1921.

Name: Eugen Weidmann
Notes: German who strangled and robbed American dancer Jean de Koven, shot a former accomplice, and shot dead and robbed four other people around Paris in 1937.

Name: Rhonda Belle Martin
Notes: Alabama poisoner who murdered six family members; executed in 1957.

Name: Leslie Irvin
Notes: Known as "The Mad Dog Killer"; Killed six people in robberies in the mid-1950s; his Supreme Court case set a precedent for fair trials of highly publicized defendants.

Name: Lemuel Smith
Notes: Confessed to the murders of five people, including an on-duty female prison guard. Sentenced to death on June 10, 1983. Commuted to life in 1984.

Name: Freeway Phantom
Notes: Raped and strangled six young women and girls in Washington, D.C. in the early 1970s, dumping their bodies by freeways.

Name: David Mason
Notes: Strangled four elderly neighbors, his cellmate when imprisoned on lesser charges; shot his boyfriend.

Name: Dayton Leroy Rogers
Notes: Killed street women, usually addicts, sex workers and runaways. He would tie, rape, and kill them in a forest.

Name: Norbert Poehlke
Notes: Known as "The Hammer-Killer", German police officer who was found, after his suicide in 1985, to have committed several bank robberies and murders.

Name: Wolfgang Schmidt
Notes: Known as the "Beast of Beelitz". Killed five women and a 3 month old baby from 1989 to 1991. Currently in a psychiatric hospital.

Name: Cleophus Prince Jr.
Notes: Known as "The Clairemont Killer"; raped and killed six women in San Diego in 1990.

Name: Nathaniel White
Notes: Convicted of stabbing to death six women in the Hudson Valley, New York area from 1991 to 1992.

Name: Samuel Bongani Mfeka
Notes: Killed 6 women from 1993 to 1996 and sentenced to life imprisonment.

Name: Gary Ray Bowles
Notes: Beat and strangled six men to death to steal their credit cards in 1994.

Name: Rory Enrique Conde
Notes: Known as "The Tamiami Trail Strangler". Killed 6 sex workers in Florida. Sentenced to death on March 7, 2000.

Name: Nicholas Lungisa Ncama
Notes: Murdered 6 people in the Eastern Cape, 1997.

Name: Aleksandr Rubel
Notes: He was intoxicated on gasoline vapour during his murders. Sentenced as a minor to the maximum punishment allowed by law — eight years imprisonment — he was released in 2006.

Name: Celine Lesage
Notes: Killed seven of her newborn babies and sentenced to 15 years in prison.

Name: Filiberto Hernández Martínez
Notes: Killed six people from 2010 to 2013 in Tamuín.

Name: Zodiac Killer
Notes: Targeted young couples. Remains unsolved but open in the California jurisdictions where the five certain Zodiac murders occurred. Potentially 37 total victims claimed but unverified.[323]

Name: Carl Panzram
Notes: From 1920 to 1928, he claimed in a posthumous autobiography to have committed over 22 killings, and sodomy of more than 1000 young men. Executed in 1930 by hanging.[324]

Name: Steve Wright
Notes: Referred to as "Suffolk murders", "Ipswich murders", "Ipswich Ripper", "Suffolk Ripper", "Suffolk Strangler", "East Anglia Ripper", "Red Light Ripper" and "the Suffolkator". Murdered five sex workers, all of whom worked in Ipswich in 2006. There are possible links to previous East Anglia prostitute killings.[325][326]

Name: Stephen Akinmurele
Notes: Nigerian man who killed himself after being charged for the murders of 5 elderly people in Blackpool and Isle of Man. He confessed to the murders. Links to 10 other unsolved murders in the areas were investigated by police.[327]

Name: Joe Metheny
Notes: Butchered his victims, then served them at BBQs at his roadside stand; died in prison.[328]

Name: Michel Peiry
Country: Switzerland  France  United States  Yugoslavia (suspected)  Italy (suspected)
Notes: Known as the "Sadist of Romont"; Swiss serial killer who sexually abused and murdered at least 5 hitchhikers in several countries; sentenced to life imprisonment.[329]

Name: Hubert Pilčík
Notes: Made money smuggling people across the Czechoslovakia-Germany border, but killed most of his customers. Total number of his victims is unknown.

Name: Melvin Rees
Notes: Known as "The Sex Beast"; shot and defiled a woman in 1957, torture-murdered a family of four in 1959 and suspected in four other killings.

Name: David Maust
Notes: Killed teenage boys; caught when bodies of three boys were found in the concrete floor of his basement in Hammond, Indiana. Committed suicide in prison in 2006.

Name: William Patrick Fyfe
Notes: Convicted of killing five women in the Montreal area of Quebec, although he claims to have killed four others. Serving a life sentence in West Canada.

Name: Willem van Eijk
Notes: Dutch serial killer known as "Het Beest van Harkstede" (The Beast of Harkstede). All proven victims he killed were all sex workers. Sentenced to 18 years imprisonment for his first two murders and killed 3 more after his release. Sentenced to life imprisonment in 2002 and died in 2019 in prison. Suspected of having killed 3 more sex workers.

Name: Danny Rolling
Notes: Known as the "Gainesville Ripper"; murdered five students in August 1990. Executed on October 6, 2006. Shortly before his execution, he gave a handwritten confession to authorities for a triple homicide of an elderly man, his adult daughter, and young grandson that occurred years earlier in Rolling's hometown of Shreveport, LA. Although Rolling was never officially charged or extradicted to LA to stand trial for the "Grissom Murders", Shreveport Police had confirmed even before the confession that Rolling had long been considered the lone suspect and the case was closed.

Name: Allan Joseph Legere
Notes: Convicted of killing five people in the Miramichi area, New Brunswick. Legere is now serving a life sentence Canada's only super maximum prison (Special Handling Unit).

Name: Joseph E. Duncan III
Notes: Convicted of killing a California boy in 1997 and four members of an Idaho family in 2005. Confessed to two 1996 murders in Washington state, but was not formally charged. Died while awaiting execution on U.S. federal death row.

Name: Vincent Johnson
Notes: "The Brooklyn Strangler".

Name: Vinko Pintarić
Notes: Murdered five people, including his wife, between 1973 and 1990. Escaped from custody three times, killed in a 1991 shootout with the police.

Name: Edward Edwards
Notes: Shot a young couple in 1977 and stabbed and strangled another in 1980; died months prior to execution on April 7, 2011, for shooting his foster son in 1996 insurance murder.

Name: Thomas Dillon
Notes: Killed outdoorsmen in rural Ohio by sniping them from afar with a hunting rifle.

Name: Marc Dutroux
Notes: Child molester who killed 4 of possibly 11 victims. He was also convicted for murdering one of his partners in crime.

Name: William Dathan Holbert
Notes: Known as "Wild Bill"; American expatriate who had the bodies of five other Americans buried on his property. He would kill people to get their money and properties. His wife, Laura Michelle Reese, was also arrested.[330]

Name: Sek Kim Wah
Notes: Sek Kim Wah, who was of Chinese Singaporean descent, was 19 years old when he killed five victims in two separate robbery cases, using raffia string to strangle them. Other methods employed were hitting their heads with a heavy object (like a wooden stool) and electrocution (which was unsuccessful). He robbed and killed a couple before abandoning their corpses at Seletar Reservoir on 30 June 1983 and then, on 23 July 1983, killed three more people at Andrew Road with an accomplice who did not take part in the killings. He was arrested and indicted for murder six days later and was sentenced to death on 14 August 1985; he lost an appeal and he was hanged on 9 December 1988.[331]

Name: Jerome Dennis
Notes: Killed Newark women while on parole.[332]

Name: Belize Ripper
Notes: The Belize Ripper was an unidentified Belizean serial killer who abducted and murdered five young girls in Belize City between 1998 and 2000.

Name: Elroy Chester
Notes: Murdered four white people in racially-motivated attacks, and also admitted to the murder of his brother-in-law. In addition, he was linked to four non-fatal shootings and three rapes.

Name: Elisabeth Wiese
Notes: Known as the "Angel Maker of St. Pauli"; baby farmer who poisoned her grandchild and four others with morphine and burned their bodies in a stove in 1902 and 1903.

Name: Phantom Killer
Notes: Believed to have committed the Texarkana Moonlight Murders in Texas between February 23 and May 4, 1946.

Name: San Mateo slasher
Notes: Known as the "Gypsy Hill killings"; five unsolved killings, of young women in San Mateo County, California during early 1976.

Name: Honolulu Strangler
Notes: Raped and strangled five young women in Hawaii in 1985 and 1986.

Name: Anthony Kirkland
Notes: Kirkland murdered four females between 2006 and 2009, three of them children, following a 16-year prison term for the murder of another woman.

Name: William MacDonald
Notes: Murdered derelicts in Sydney and Brisbane between 1960 and 1962; sentenced to five consecutive life sentences.

Name: Harry Powers
Notes: "Lonely Hearts" swindler and conman. Killed two women and three children in Quiet Dell, West Virginia. Arrested after the bodies were found buried near his garage in 1931 and hanged in 1932.

Name: Anna Marie Hahn
Notes: German-born murder-for-profit killer who poisoned five elderly men; executed in 1938.

Name: Robert Nixon
Notes: Killed 5 women in the 1930s with bricks. Executed by electrocution in Illinois on June 15, 1939.

Name: Waneta Hoyt
Notes: New York woman who murdered her five children.

Name: Janie Lou Gibbs
Notes: Georgia poisoner who killed five family members. Sentenced to life. Died in prison on February 7, 2010.

Name: South Dade Killer
Notes: Known as the "Flat-Tire murders". Killed 5 women in 1975.

Name: Gerald Parker
Notes: Known as "The Bedroom Basher" raped and murdered five women and killed the unborn baby of a sixth woman in Orange County, California.

Name: Phillip Carl Jablonski
Notes: convicted of killing five women in California and Utah between 1978 and 1991. Sentenced to death in 1994.

Name: Arthur Gary Bishop
Notes: Utah man who murdered five young boys; executed in 1988.

Name: Faryion Wardrip
Notes: Killed five young women around Wichita Falls, Texas between 1984 and 1986.

Name: Timothy Wilson Spencer
Notes: Known as "The Southside Strangler"; raped and killed five women in Virginia. Executed in the electric chair on April 27, 1994.

Name: Robert Shulman
Notes: Convicted of murdering five sex workers between 1991 and 1996.

Name: Elias Abuelazam
Notes: Known as "The Serial Slasher". Israeli-Arab immigrant that stabbed victims to death. Sentenced to life on June 25, 2012.

Name: Joachim Knychała
Notes: Known as "The Vampire of Bytom" or "Frankenstein", who murdered five women between 1975 and 1982.[333]

Name: Archibald Hall
Notes: Called "The Monster Butler". Died in prison in 2002.

Name: Colin Ireland
Notes: Called "The Gay Slayer". A highly organized serial killer, Ireland picked passive masochist gay men in the Coleherne public house, accompanied them home, and murdered them after they were voluntarily restrained. He then cleaned the house of forensic evidence and left when he was sure of not appearing suspicious.

Name: Claude Lastennet
Notes: Convicted of murdering 5 old women between August 1993 and January 1994.[334]

Name: Metod Trobec
Notes: Raped, killed and cremated five women in his home. Also tried to murder two other immates while in prison before committing suicide in his cell in 2006.

Name: Romulus Vereş
Notes: Known as "The Hammer Man". Institutionalized.

Name: Akira Nishiguchi
Notes: Fraudster, murdered two people while engaging in confidence scams and killed three others while on the run from justice. Hanged in 1970.

Name: Boris Gusakov
Notes: Known as "Student Hunter"; committed 15 sexual assaults, including 5 murders, on girls and young women from 1964 to 1968.

Name: Anatoly Biryukov
Notes: Known as "The Hunter of Babies": responsible for the kidnappings and subsequent murders of five infants from Moscow in the fall of 1977.

Name: Süleyman Aktaş
Notes: Known as "The Nailing Killer": responsible for the murders of five people in 1986 and 1994.

Name: B1 Butcher
Notes: Murdered at least five women between 2005 and 2007, with all murders related to the National Road B1.

Name: Alexander Spesivtsev
Notes: Cannibal known as "The Novokuznetsk Monster"; admitted to 19 murders, but 82 bloody sets of clothes were found in his home, along with jewels and photographs of possibly unidentified victims. Found insane and interned in a mental hospital. His mother was sentenced to 16 years in prison for luring Spesivtsev's victims to their home.[335]

Name: Charlie Brandt
Notes: Killed himself by hanging after murdering his wife and niece. The latter was also decapitated and eviscerated in a manner strongly similar to 26 unsolved murders of women in Florida, starting in 1973, the year Brandt moved to the state. Brandt was later considered the culprit in one of these murders, due to his strong resemblance to a suspect who was filmed by a traffic camera near the place where one body was found. He could not be officially tied to the other crimes due to lack of evidence. Previously, when he was 13 years old in 1971, he attempted to murder his whole family with a gun, for no apparent reason. His mother (who was pregnant) died in this attack, but his father survived, and his sister escaped.[336]

Name: Scott Lee Kimball
Notes: A skilled forger who, while he ran a legitimate business buying and selling organic beef, primarily enriched himself by passing bad checks on the accounts of others and using forged documents; by 2003 he had faced criminal charges in four Western states. These white-collar crimes also enabled his murders, by allowing him to create evidence that his victims were still alive after he had killed them; he also used their checking accounts and credit cards to further his schemes once they were dead. For the first year of his murder activity, he worked as an informant for the FBI, which both paid him and protected him from facing justice over some of his fraud schemes.

Name: Robert Black
Country: United Kingdom  Ireland (suspected)  West Germany (suspected)  Netherlands (suspected)  France (suspected)
Notes: Convicted of kidnapping, raping and murdering four girls aged between five and 11. Suspect in other earlier child murders in the UK and other European countries. Died weeks before he was to be charged with a fifth child murder.[337]

Name: Max Gufler
Notes: Poisoned and drowned four women, but suspected of killing 18 in total.

Name: Ernesto Picchioni
Notes: Murdered people who approached his home; died of cardiac arrest in 1967.

Name: Baekuni
Notes: Child rapist who killed young boys; initially sentenced to life imprisonment, but changed to the death sentence.[338]

Name: Igor Chernat
Notes: Known as the "Evil Spirit of Kaukjarvi"; Ukrainian soldier who raped and killed women in Kamenka, selling their stolen items afterwards; executed 1987.[339]

Name: Ricky Lee Green
Notes: Bisexual drifter who killed people he met in bars; his wife assisted in two of the murders; executed in 1997.[340]

Name: Robert Hicks Murray
Notes: Bigamist who murdered his wife and three children in a murder-suicide; posthumously revealed to have killed previous wives as well.[341]

Name: William Dean Christensen
Notes: Known as "The American Jack the Ripper"; murdered and mutilated three women and one man; Canadian and US authorities also investigated him as a suspect in a total of ten murders, but he died before any of these claims could be confirmed.[342]

Name: Angus Sinclair
Notes: Scottish man who was originally convicted of murdering a 7-year-old girl when he was 16. As well as being convicted of the murders of three women in 1977 and 1978, police suspect he was responsible for four other murders of women in Glasgow in these years.[343] Also a suspect in two other murders in 1970 and 1979 respectively.[344][345]

Name: John Cooper
Notes: Psychopathic Welsh burglar who was convicted in 2011 of the double shotgun murders of a couple on the Pembrokeshire coast in 1989 and another during a botched burglary nearby in 1985. Police believed he killed at least one other woman in 1989, and investigated the possibility he could also have been responsible for another double shotgun murder in Bridgend in 1993. A forensic pathologist also claimed to police that he could have been responsible for two murders of elderly siblings in Pembrokeshire in 1976.[346][347][348]

Name: Cary Stayner
Notes: Known as "The Yosemite Killer". Killed four women in Yosemite, California. Sentenced to death. Brother of kidnapping victim Steven Stayner.

Name: Tony Costa
Notes: Dismembered and mutilated 4 women in Cape Cod in the late 1960s; linked to at least 4 other deaths and disappearances.

Name: Carlton Gary
Notes: Gary was convicted of raping and strangling three elderly women in Columbus, Georgia between 1977 and 1978, although police and prosecutors believe him to be responsible for up to seven rape-murders in Columbus. DNA also linked him to an additional murder in Syracuse, New York, but prosecutors did not charge him because he was already on death row.

Name: Oakland County Child Killer
Notes: Unidentified person or persons who abducted and murdered at least four children in Oakland County, Michigan, between 1976 and 1977.

Name: Robert Rozier
Notes: Former NFL player that was convicted of four murders but confessed to seven as a member of the Nation of Yahweh.

Name: Leonard Fraser
Notes: Serial rapist and pedophile who murdered four women in Rockhampton. Sentenced to five consecutive life sentences plus 25 years without the possibility of parole; died in prison of a heart attack in 2007.

Name: Christopher Peterson
Notes: Peterson was convicted of four fatal shootings by the so-called "Shotgun Killer" that occurred between October and December 1990. He was charged in three other murders related to the killing spree but was acquitted.

Name: Ricardo Caputo
Notes: Was No. 1 of the FBI Ten Most Wanted Fugitives during his time as a fugitive in the 1980s. Surrendered himself to justice in 1994 and died of cardiac arrest in prison three years later.

Name: Anthony Allen Shore
Notes: Known as "The Tourniquet Killer"; convicted of strangling a woman with an unusual ligature in 1992 and confessed to killing three girls including two with same MO.

Name: Daytona Beach killer
Notes: Murdered four, possibly five, women in Daytona Beach, Florida between 2005 and 2007.

Name: Jozef Slovák
Notes: Suspected by investigators of more murders, but only four could be proven.

Name: Monster of Udine
Notes: Killed at least 4 victims in the Province of Udine, Italy.[349]

Name: John Martin Crawford
Notes: Convicted in 1996 for the murders of three native women.

Name: Oba Chandler
Notes: Convicted for the June 1989 murders of Joan Rogers and her two daughters, whose bodies were found floating in Tampa Bay, Florida with their hands and feet bound. Autopsies showed the victims had been thrown into the water while still alive, with ropes tied to a concrete block around their necks. Chandler was executed in 2011. In February 2014, DNA evidence also identified Chandler as the murderer of Ivelisse Berrios-Beguerisse, who was found dead in Coral Springs, Florida, on November 27, 1990.

Name: Dallen Bounds
Notes: Murdered a Radio Shack manager, and a florist at their respective places of business. Then murdered two acquaintances before taking two others hostage and committing suicide. Suspected of additional murders in the Pacific Northwest.

Name: Wayne Adam Ford
Notes: Confessed to murdering four women; believed to have killed others.

Name: Heinrich Pommerenke
Notes: Killed four women.

Name: Robert Mone
Notes: Scottish man who shot dead a teacher at his former school in Dundee in 1967. Later escaped from a secure hospital in 1976 and killed three more.[350]

Name: Jerry Brudos
Notes: Brudos was a necrophiliac who had a fascination with women's shoes, and would often dress his victims' corpses in women's clothing.[351]

Name: Robert Maudsley
Notes: Sentenced to life without parole in 1974 for murdering a man who had shown him pictures of young boys he had sexually abused. Subsequently, killed another child sex offender in Broadmoor high-security hospital and two more, including a child sex offender, in prison. Has been held in solitary confinement since 1983.

Name: Aalt Mondria
Notes: Dutch criminal and serial killer who committed four murders and was responsible for a large number of assaults. Mondria was considered extremely violent and aggressive. After a notorious murder of his girlfriend's 10-year-old son, he was sentenced to 18 years imprisonment in 1998, after initially receiving life imprisonment for three murders in 1978, for which he also received 15 years imprisonment.

Name: Tsutomu Miyazaki
Notes: Japanese man who murdered four young girls between August 1988 and June 1989 popularly known as the Otaku Killer. He was active in Tokyo and Saitama Prefecture.

Name: Cody Legebokoff
Notes: Canadian serial killer convicted in 2014 by the British Columbia Supreme Court of murdering three women and one teenage girl, between 2009 and 2010, in or near the city of Prince George, British Columbia. He is one of Canada's youngest convicted serial killers.

Name: Stephen Port
Notes: Nicknamed "The Grindr Killer", Port met his victims via online gay social networks. He used gamma-Hydroxybutyric acid (GHB), a date rape drug, adding it to drinks given to his victims, raped them, and murdered four of them in his flat in Barking, east London.

Name: Howell Donaldson III
Notes: Murdered four people in the Seminole Heights neighborhood of Tampa, Florida in October and November 2017. All four victims were shot dead seemingly at random.[352] Sentenced to four consecutive life sentences without parole in May 2023.[353][354]

Name: Arnold Sodeman
Notes: Sodeman was convicted of murdering four children between 1930 and 1935. He would abduct children, gag them and tie their hands behind their back with their own clothing and then strangle them to death. Sodeman was one of the last eleven people to be executed in Victoria.

Name: Craig Price
Notes: Murdered four people during violent attacks in their homes in Warwick, Rhode Island when he was a teenager.

Name: Fritz Honka
Notes: Strangled sex workers who refused to service him in the way that he wanted.

Name: Cayetano Santos Godino
Notes: Known as Petiso Orejudo ("the Big-eared Midget"). Teenage arsonist, animal killer and child murderer with congenital syphilis. Arrested at age 16 in 1912 for killing 4 children, although he tried to kill seven more, the first one when he was seven himself. Interned in 1913 in a reformatory, where he tried to kill other immates, and from 1915 in prison. Died in jail in 1948.

Name: Eastbound Strangler
Notes: Killed four women in October and November 2006 in Atlantic City, NJ. Each was placed about sixty feet apart in a drainage ditch filled with shallow water. They were facing east and missing their socks.

Name: Caroline Grills
Notes: Poisoned four people (most of them relatives) with thallium hidden in tea and scones she had given them in Sydney. Sentenced to five consecutive life sentences (including one for attempting to poison another family member); died from peritonitis in 1960.

Name: Gordon Cummins
Notes: Raped three of his victims and robbed the remaining one. Also attacked two other women. Sentenced to death by hanging.

Name: Marc Sappington
Notes: Schizophrenic serial killer who heard voices telling him to kill after extended daily PCP use. He cannibalized part of his last victim.

Name: Peter Woodcock
Notes: Sexual sadist and child rapist. Killed three young children in Toronto in the 1950s. Sentenced to a psychiatric facility, where he murdered a fellow inmate in 1991.

Name: Léopold Dion
Notes: Known as the "Monster of Port-Rouge". Canadian sex offender and serial killer who was active in Quebec. Sentenced to hang but stabbed to death on November 17, 1972, by fellow inmate Normand "Lawrence d'Arabie" Champagne, who was found not guilty by reason of insanity.

Name: John Ingvar Lövgren
Notes: Confessed to four murders committed between 1958 and 1963 in the Stockholm region.

Name: Lam Kor-wan
Notes: Taxi driver and one of Hong Kong's only two known serial killers. Famous for keeping body parts in his parents' home.

Name: Jürgen Bartsch
Notes: Killed four, one escaped; died by wrongful overdose during castration surgery.

Name: Wayne Boden
Notes: Known as "the Vampire Rapist" killed 4 women between 1968 and 1971; died in prison 2006

Name: Ion Rîmaru
Notes: Known as "The Vampire of Bucharest". Attacked 15 lone waitresses as they returned from work with a hammer, hatchet, knife or iron bar, always after midnight and under unusual weather (snowstorms, fog, hard rain, etc.). Four were killed.

Name: David Meirhofer
Notes: Killed three children and an ex-girlfriend between 1967 and 1974; first serial killer apprehended by offender profiling.

Name: Donald Neilson
Notes: Armed robber and murderer known as the "Black Panther". Died in prison in 2011.

Name: Thor Nis Christiansen
Notes: Shot dead and committed necrophilia on 4 young women in Isla Vista, California in the late 1970s. Stabbed to death in prison on March 30, 1981; killer unknown.

Name: Michael Lupo
Notes: Called himself "The Wolf Man". Murdered four men after being diagnosed with HIV, died in prison in 1995.

Name: Peter Lundin
Notes: Killed his mother in 1991, then killed his mistress and her two children 9 years later; Sentenced to prison.

Name: James Swann
Notes: Known as The Shotgun Stalker; killed 4 and injured 5 in Washington D.C. in 1993.

Name: Steven Grieveson
Notes: Murdered four boys in an attempt to conceal his homosexuality.

Name: Frank Gust
Notes: Kill four women form 1994 to 1998. Sentenced to life imprisonment.

Name: Alexander Tchayka
Notes: All the victims were women wearing fur coats and were stabbed multiple times (21 in one case).

Name: Peter Moore
Notes: Stabbed and mutilated four men. Imprisoned for life since 1996.

Name: Hiroaki Hidaka
Notes: Killed and robbed four women. Hanged in 2006.

Name: Nicolai Bonner
Notes: Born in Moldova, Bonner beat to death four fellow immigrants from the former Soviet Union, three of whom were homeless, and then tried to set them on fire. Sentenced to life imprisonment in 2007.

Name: Raúl Osiel Marroquín
Notes: Called "The Sadist". Lured men in gay bars and strangled them, abandoning their bodies inside suitcases all over Mexico City. Two other victims were released after demanding a ransom from their families.

Name: Harvey Miguel Robinson
Notes: An American serial killer who murdered three women when he was only 18 years-old.

Name: Albert Fish
Notes: American serial killer and child rapist who confessed to three murders for which he was convicted and sentenced to death.[355]

Name: Robert Ben Rhoades
Notes: Convicted of murdering three women in Texas and Illinois between 1989 and 1990. Sentenced to life imprisonment.[356]

Name: Peter Tobin
Notes: Scottish rapist and serial killer known to have killed at least three young women. Was also previously a suspect in the Bible John murders committed in Glasgow during the late 1960s, although police have now dismissed the theory.[357][358]

Name: Pedro Padilla Flores
Notes: Killed three women in 1986; fled to the US but recaptured and deported back to Mexico; main suspect in the Ciudad Juárez Murders.[359]

Name: Stephen Morin
Notes: Convicted of murdering three women within a period of five weeks in 1981. Sentenced to the death penalty.[361]

Name: Dorothea Puente
Notes: Ran a boarding house in Sacramento where she poisoned tenants and buried them in the yard in order to steal their social security checks.[362]

Name: Billy Glaze
Notes: Known as "Butcher Knife Billy". Killer convicted of raping and murdering three Native American sex workers in Minneapolis in 1986 and 1987.[363]

Name: Sidney Cooke
Notes: Described by The Guardian newspaper in 1999 as "Britain's most notorious paedophile", Cooke and his infamous paedophile ring were convicted of the murder of 14-year-old Jason Swift in 1984. They were also known by police to have been responsible for the abductions and murders of children Barry Lewis and Mark Tildesley. Cooke was the ringleader of the gang, who are believed to have murdered up to 20 children, possibly including Vishal Mehrotra and Martin Allen.[364][365]

Name: Bertha Gifford
Notes: Found not guilty by reason of insanity of three arsenic poisonings and suspected of 14 other killings, mostly children, in Missouri.[366]

Name: Bernhard Prigan
Notes: Killed women near highways; confessed to a total of 16 murders.[367]

Name: Patrick Mackay[a]
Notes: Burglar suspect of 12 violent murders during robberies, charged with five, convicted of three. The two other cases were left to lie on file, and proof was later found by police that he had killed one of these victims.[368] Confessed to police that he had killed 13 people.[369][368] Has been eligible for parole since 1995 and since 2017 has been held in an open prison with day release provisions.[370] Now known as 'David Groves'.[370]

Name: Koos Hertogs
Notes: Dutch serial killer convicted of abducting, torturing, raping and killing three girls. Suspected of killing a further three to nine girls and young women in the 1970s.

Name: Michael Gargiulo
Notes: Dubbed "The Hollywood Ripper", Gargiulo stabbed 3 women to death, and tried to kill a fourth woman. Sentenced to death in 2021 but still on death row.

Name: Chisako Kakehi
Notes: Poisoned her husband and two other men to death, but suspected in another seven deaths; sentenced to death.[371]

Name: Heriberto Seda
Notes: Considered to be a copycat of the Zodiac Killer. Claimed to have killed people based on their zodiac signs, and only killed when certain star formations were out.

Name: Anthony Hardy
Notes: Known as the "Camden Ripper", killed and dismembered three sex workers in Camden, London in 2002. Police believe he could be responsible for the murders of three other sex workers in London in the 1990s and two others in Nottinghamshire. One other unsolved murder he was linked to was solved in 2011 when her former partner John Sweeney was convicted of her murder.[372][373][374]

Name: Michael Lee Lockhart
Notes: Multi-state serial killer who received death sentences in three states (Florida, Indiana, and Texas). He was executed in 1997 in Texas.

Name: Peter Dupas
Notes: Sexual sadist from Melbourne, who murdered three women and is suspected of at least three further killings. Was convicted of 16 separate acts of sexual violence before his first murder charge. Serving three consecutive life sentences without the possibility of parole.

Name: Stephen Griffiths
Notes: Known to have killed three sex workers, but claimed to police to have killed 6.[375] Has been a suspect in one other murder.[376] Dubbed himself the "Crossbow Cannibal" as he killed his victims with a hammer and crossbow and then later ate parts of them.[377]

Name: Levi Bellfield
Notes: West London serial killer convicted of two fatal hammer attacks on women and the murder of Milly Dowler. Also a suspect in the murders of his childhood girlfriend Patsy Morris in 1980, Judith Gold, who was hit over the head in 1990,[378][379] and Elizabeth Chau, who disappeared in 1999 and whose murder Bellfield has allegedly confessed to.[380]

Name: Hans van Zon
Notes: After the relationship between Hans van Zon and his girlfriend ended in April 1967, van Zon alleged that she continued to impose on him. To put an end to this, he went into her house and killed her with a self-made lead pipe. He also killed an 80-year-old shopkeeper, and a milkman in robberies. In addition to the murders he was tried for, van Zon was also suspected of several other murders, including the lust murder of Elly Segov in 1964 and the murder of the English homosexual film director Claude Berkeley in 1965.

Name: Judy Buenoano
Notes: Poisoned her husband, boyfriend and son with arsenic; drowned the son in 1980 but caught in 1983 after poisoning and car bombing a fiancée.

Name: Martin Ney
Notes: Wore a mask while killing 3 and sexually assaulting at least 40 children.

Name: Paul Denyer
Notes: The "Frankston Killer", sentenced to three consecutive life sentences with a non-parole period of 30 years.

Name: Bandali Debs
Notes: Convicted of the murder of Kirsty Harty at Upper Beaconsfield in 1997, and of the Moorabbin Police murders 14 months later to avoid arrest for a string of armed robberies; sentenced to three consecutive life sentences plus 27 years without the possibility of parole.

Name: Gordon Northcott
Notes: Pedophile who abducted and murdered boys aged between 10 and 12 in Los Angeles and then disposed of the bodies with the help of his mother, Sarah Louise Northcott, and his underage nephew Sanford Clark, whom Northcott had repeatedly threatened and sexually abused. Police considered Northcott a suspect in the disappearance of as many as 20 missing boys in the area that Northcott admitted to have molested, but not murdered; one of these boys surfaced years later alive and confirmed Northcott's version. According to Clark, only four boys were held and murdered in Northcott's property; the three LA children whose remains were found and for whom Northcott was hanged, and an unidentified Mexican boy that Northcott beheaded and disposed of the body near La Puente, California.

Name: Peter Kudzinowski
Notes: Convicted and executed for the murder of an adult in Scranton, Pennsylvania and two children in New Jersey. Also suspect in the death of two other children in New York City, although Albert Fish later confessed to have murdered one of them himself.

Name: Harvey Glatman
Notes: Known as "The Lonely Hearts Killer"; Californian rapist and killer; lured women to pose for "bondage photographs"; executed in the gas chamber on September 18, 1959.

Name: Martha Ann Johnson
Notes: Convicted of smothering three of her children in Atlanta between 1977 and 1982. Sentenced to life in prison on May 5, 1990.

Name: Vlado Taneski
Notes: A crime journalist, Taneski came under suspicion when his articles on the rape and murder of three elderly women included information that had not been disclosed by the police. All the victims were poor, uneducated cleaners and knew Taneski's mother. Taneski killed himself in prison before he could be interrogated for the murder of a fourth woman.

Name: Özkan Zengin
Notes: Slit the throats of three confirmed victims before dumping the bodies in wells. Reportedly confessed to an additional murder.[381]

Name: Khalil Wheeler-Weaver
Notes: American serial killer from Orange, New Jersey, Wheeler-Weaver lured his victims using dating apps and murdered three women and attempted to kill a fourth between August 2016 and November 2016. One of the victim's friends created a fake account and lured him to a meeting before notifying police.[382]

Name: William Henry Hance
Notes: Hance murdered three women in and around military bases in the late 1970s. He attempted to blame two of the murders on white vigilantes outraged over a series of murders later attributed to Carlton Gary. Hance was also blamed for the murder of a fourth woman at Fort Benjamin Harrison in Indiana but was never brought to trial for this crime.

Name: "Charlie Chop-off"
Notes: Unidentified assailant who attacked young black and Puerto Rican boys and mutilated their genitals with a straight razor, killing three and leaving one castrated. Another suspected victim was killed but did not have his genitals mutilated. A single suspect was arrested for attempting to abduct another boy, confessed to one of the murders and was hesitantly identified by the surviving victim, but was found unfit for trial and may have been in a mental hospital during the murders.

Name: François Vérove
Notes: Nicknamed "Le Grêlé" ("the pockmarked man"), Verove a former police officer is blamed for four murders and a series of rapes since 1986. His confessed was found on his suicide note alongside body after he killed himself in 2021. The crimes include the 1986 murder of an 11-year-old child, Cécile Bloch, in Paris.[383][384]

Name: Louise Peete
Notes: Convicted of murdering a man and woman decades apart, four other acquaintances died suspiciously and four husbands committed suicide.

Name: Westley Allan Dodd
Notes: Dodd had an extensive arrest record for molesting children by the time his behavior escalated to include murder. Refusing to appeal his death sentence, he stated that he "should be punished to the full extent of the law, as should all sex offenders and murderers", and that if he ever escaped, he would immediately return to "killing and raping kids". Executed in 1993; his hanging was the first in the United States in 28 years.

Name: Scott Erskine
Notes: Convicted of raping and murdering a woman in 1989 and the torture-murders of 2 boys in 1993. May be linked to other murders.

Name: Donald Leroy Evans
Notes: Murdered a young girl and two women. Suspected of another dozen murders but recanted confessions to over 70 more. Stabbed to death by another death row inmate on January 5, 1999.

Name: John Martin
Notes: (Birth name John Martin Scripps, alias Simon James Davis) While on the run after escaping Britain, Martin killed at least three tourists between 8 and 14 March 1995 and robbed them of their possessions and money: one in Singapore and two in Thailand. He also dismembered their bodies and dumped them in various areas, such as the sea or abandoned places. Martin was also alleged to have killed at least three more people in other countries, such as the US, but these were unconfirmed. He was arrested in Changi Airport when he returned to Singapore on 19 March 1995, and was charged with murder. Martin was found guilty of the one murder he committed in Singapore and thus sentenced to death in November 1995. Martin was executed on 19 April 1996, after he declined to appeal against his sentence.[385]

Name: Richard Evonitz
Notes: Abducted and killed 3 girls in Spotsylvania County, Virginia in 1996 and 1997

Name: Harvey Carignan
Notes: Serving a life sentence at the Minnesota Correctional Facility – Faribault for the murders of two women. He had been previously convicted for a 1949 rape and murder he committed while stationed in the U.S. Army, in Anchorage, Alaska.

Name: John Joubert
Notes: Joubert killed a young boy in Maine and two boys in Nebraska. He was executed by the State of Nebraska in 1996.

Name: Akku Yadav
Notes: Murdered at least three people and dumped their bodies on the railroad tracks; lynched by a mob of around 200 women.[386]

Name: Michael Madison
Notes: American serial killer from East Cleveland, Ohio who committed at least three murders.

Name: "Bible John"
Notes: Unidentified serial killer who murdered three women in Glasgow, Scotland.[387] Convicted serial killer Peter Tobin was suspected in the murders, but has since been eliminated as a suspect.[358]

Name: Andrew Dawson
Notes: Killed an elderly man during a burglary in 1982. Following his release from prison, he stabbed two of his neighbors to death in separate incidents, describing himself as an "Angel of Mercy". He is currently Derby's only serial killer.[388]

Name: Leonarda Cianciulli
Notes: Murdered three women in the town of Correggio, Reggio Emilia, and turned their bodies into soap and cakes.[389]

Name: Sharon Kinne
Notes: Sociopathic serial killer that murdered romantic partners with a handgun. Currently still at large since her escape from prison in 1969.

Name: Ted Kaczynski
Notes: Domestic terrorist and serial bomber known as the "Unabomber", Kaczynski was responsible for more than two dozen bombings of universities and one airline bombing from 1978 to 1996, justified by Kaczynski by his philosophy that technological advancements would destroy humanity. Arrested in 1996 due to his brother David recognizing the then unidentified Unabomber's manifesto titled Industrial Society and Its Future as the work of Kaczynski. Died in prison on June 10, 2023.[390]

Name: Leon Dorsey
Notes: Murdered three people from 4 April-11 September 1994. He was serving 60 years for the murder of an Ellis County convenience store employee when surveillance camera footage linked him to the murders of two other people. He was convicted and sentenced to death in June 2000, and executed on 12 August 2008.

Name: Ronald Jebson
Notes: Jebson, a prolific child molester, was convicted of raping and killing the eight-year-old daughter of acquaintances in 1974. While serving his sentence he pled guilty to molesting and murdering two other children, Susan Blatchford and Gary Hanlon, in 1970.

Name: Charles Albanese
Notes: Albanese poisoned his wife's mother and grandmother and his father with arsenic in order to obtain inheritance money, and unsuccessfully tried to poison his brother and mother. He was sentenced to death in two separate trials and ultimately executed in 1995.

Name: George Chapman
Notes: Poisoned three consecutive mistresses with tartar emetic. Considered the possible identity of Jack the Ripper at the time of his execution (1903).

Name: Martha Rendell
Notes: Killed three stepchildren with hydrochloric acid in the 20th century; last woman to be hanged in Western Australia.

Name: George Joseph Smith
Notes: Known as "The Brides in the Bath Murders"; killer of three women. Executed by hanging on August 13, 1915.

Name: Daisy de Melker
Notes: Poisoner; killed two husbands and one son from 1923 to 1932.

Name: Eddie Leonski
Notes: Confessed to three murders after being picked out of a line of American servicemen by witnesses. Sentenced to death and hanged.

Name: William Heirens
Notes: Burglar who stabbed three females between. Known as "The Lipstick Killer".

Name: John Straffen
Notes: Killed his third victim after escaping from the mental hospital where he was recluded for the first two murders. Longest-held prisoner in modern British history at the time of his death in 2007.

Name: Richard Laurence Marquette
Notes: First 11th name on FBI 10 Most Wanted for killing, mutilating and dismembering a woman in 1961; killed two more with same MO upon 1973 release.

Name: Graham Young
Notes: Called the "Teacup Poisoner". Poisoned over 70 people, 3 of whom died.

Name: Charles Schmid
Notes: Known as "The Pied Piper of Tucson"; murdered three teenage girls in 1964 and 1965 and buried them in the desert.

Name: Lee Roy Martin
Notes: Known as "The Gaffney Strangler"; killed two women and two girls in South Carolina in 1967 and 1968.

Name: Erwin Hagedorn
Notes: Killed three boys ages 9 to 12. Was convicted and executed in 1972.

Name: Karl F. Warner
Notes: Convicted of murdering three teenage girls, in two separate incidents, in the San Francisco Bay Area communities of San Jose and Saratoga, he was briefly suspected of being the notorious Zodiac Killer, but was soon ruled out as a suspect in that case.

Name: Howard Arthur Allen
Notes: Killed three elderly people, as well as assault, burglary, and arson. Sentenced to death June 11, 1988.

Name: Trevor Hardy
Notes: Called "The Monster of Manchester". Died in prison in 2012.

Name: Steven David Catlin
Notes: Poisoned three people from 1976 to 1984. Sentenced to death in 1990.

Name: Paul Michael Stephani
Notes: Known as "The Weepy-Voiced Killer"; would call police and ask for help after murders. Killed 3 women in the cities of Saint Paul and Minneapolis, Minnesota.

Name: Dámaso Rodríguez Martín
Notes: Serial rapist and voyeur known as "The Warlock". After being sentenced to 55 years for murdering a man and raping his girlfriend in 1981, he escaped from prison in 1991 and fled to the Anaga mountains in Tenerife, where he killed a couple of German hikers (the woman was also raped). Cornered in an abandoned house, Martín shot himself unsuccessfully and was then shot dead by law enforcement.

Name: Altemio Sanchez
Notes: Known as "The Bike Path Rapist" for murdering three women and raping at least 14 others in and around the Buffalo, New York area. Sentenced to 75 years in prison without the possibility of parole.

Name: Gregory Brazel
Notes: Shot dead a woman in 1982 armed robbery and murdered two sex workers in 1990.

Name: Brian Dugan
Notes: Convicted of murdering 2 girls and a woman between 1983 and 1985.[391]

Name: Valery Asratyan
Notes: Raped dozens of women in Moscow, murdering three. Executed.

Name: Francisca Ballesteros
Notes: "The Black Widow of Valencia". Poisoned her husband and three children, one of whom survived. Sentenced to 85 years in prison in 2005.

Name: Silvo Plut
Country: SR Slovenia  Serbia and Montenegro  Slovenia
Notes: After serving 13 years in prison in Slovenia for a rape and murder, Plut murdered a second woman in Serbia in 2004 and fled back to Slovenia, where a Serbian petition of extradition was turned down by the government. Plut was then arrested for attacking a couple (wife died, husband survived) and sentenced to 30 years in prison. Committed suicide in 2007.

Name: Gabriel Garza Hoth
Notes: Known as "The Black Widower", killed 3 women between 1991 and 1998, his victims were wives and lovers.

Name: Robert Napper
Notes: Rapist and murderer who mutilated one of his victims so badly that the policeman who found her was put into therapy for two years. Suspected of up to 70 violent sexual attacks in South East London attributed to the unidentified "Green Chain Rapist".

Name: Antonis Daglis
Notes: "The Athens Ripper". A serial rapist with antecedents for violence, Daglis upgraded to raping, strangling and dismembering three sex workers with a hacksaw in 1992, and tried to kill six more women. In his trial he claimed to hate all sex workers. Killed himself in prison in 1997.

Name: Gustavo Romero Tercero
Notes: "The Valdepeñas Killer". Armed robber and rapist, he killed a couple after the woman recognized him in 1993, and another woman in 1998 after accidentally hitting her with his car, fearing that a possible investigation would link him to the other crimes. Confessed and was sentenced to 83 years in prison for all crimes in 2003, after his ex-wife denounced him.

Name: Peter Bryan
Notes: A paranoid schizophrenic, Bryan was recluded in a mental institution after killing a shop assistant with a hammer in 1993. Released 11 years later after psychiatrists noted his "continued improvement", Bryan immediately killed a friend and was apprehended when he was frying his brains on a pan. Months later, Bryan killed a fellow mental patient, declaring that he didn't eat him solely because he was caught first. Currently imprisoned for life.

Name: Lam Kwok-wai
Notes: Convicted of 10 rapes and 3 murders that he committed with his bare hands. One of two only known serial killers in Hong Kong.

Name: Dana Sue Gray
Notes: Convicted of murder of three elderly women and attempted murder of a fourth in California.[392]

Name: Robin Ligus
Notes: Died in a mental institution in 2012.

Name: Jack Owen Spillman
Notes: Known as "The Werewolf Butcher"; killed two girls and the mother of one of them in Washington State in 1994 and 1995.

Name: Scott Williams
Notes: Killed and mutilated three women between 1997 and 2006. Sentenced to life.

Name: Juan Covington
Notes: Shot and killed 3 people.[393]

Name: Matthew James Harris
Notes: Strangled a friend's brother, a female friend and a male neighbour to death over five weeks in 1998 in Wagga Wagga.

Name: Yukio Yamaji
Notes: Murdered his own mother in 2000, and then murdered a 27-year-old woman and her 19-year-old sister in 2005.[394]

Name: Hiroshi Maeue
Notes: Called the "Suicide Website Murderer" for finding his victims in an online suicide community. Maeue offered to painlessly kill themselves together by charcoal burning in a car, but once together he strangled them with his bare hands instead, as this excited him sexually. Hanged in 2009.

Name: António Luís Costa
Notes: Ex-soldier, suffocated three women (and mutilated the first one) in Santa Comba Dao.

Name: Özgür Dengiz
Notes: Known as "The Cannibal of Ankara" for eating one of his victims; a third victim survived. Interned in a mental institution after his conviction to two life sentences was overturned.

Name: Mario Alberto Sulú Canché
Notes: Killed 3 women from 2007 to 2008; later committing suicide by hanging in prison.

Name: Joanna Dennehy
Notes: Carried out the Peterborough ditch murders. Over a period of two weeks, murdered her landlord and two of her house mates by stabbing them. With the help of accomplices she dumped the bodies in ditches, then attempted to kill two strangers in broad daylight by stabbing them. Given whole life tariff on 28 February 2014.

Name: Kimberly McCarthy
Notes: Executed for murdering her neighbour, 71-year-old Dorothy Booth; DNA evidence proved she had murdered two other elderly women, but she was never charged.

Name: Larry Hall
Notes: Hall traveled around the American Midwest as part of his interest in historical reenactments, which he would also use as a cover for stalking, raping, and murdering teenage girls. It is believed his first murders were committed when he was 18 years old. Although he was convicted of kidnapping 15-year-old Jessica Roach, Hall has never been charged with murder. Authorities have tied 15 murders to Hall, though only been able to confirm two, he has admitted to (and recanted) committing 39, though the FBI believes he could have committed as many as 50 in at least three states.[395]

Name: Alejandro Máynez
Notes: Killed at least two women in Ciudad Juárez, but believed to be 50. Supposedly, along with Ana Benavides and Melchor Máynez.

Name: Billy Gohl
Notes: Alleged to have killed from 40 to 140 seamen in Aberdeen, Washington

Name: Gerard John Schaefer
Notes: Florida police officer who killed up to 34 women and girls. Stabbed to death by fellow inmate Vincent Faustino Rivera on December 3, 1995.

Name: Macario Alcala Canchola
Notes: Known as "Mexican Jack"; convicted of the murders of two sex workers but suspected of at least twelve more murders.

Name: Bruce Lindahl
Notes: Accidentally killed himself while stabbing one of his victims.

Name: Robert Zarinsky
Notes: Killed people between 1958 and 1974.

Name: Ed Gein
Notes: Famous for his necrophiliac behaviours, as well as using/storing body parts of his victims to make household furniture, clothing and other miscellaneous household items.

Name: José Luis Calva
Notes: Killed and cannibalized women. Hanged himself in prison after being convicted to 84 years for two murders.

Name: Shirley Winters
Notes: Confessed in 2008 to killing 2 children (including her 5-month old son), 27 years apart. Plea agreement for those murders included clause stopping investigation of her role in a fire that killed 2 previous children in 1979. Is also a suspect in a separate fire that killed 3 children of a friend in 1979.

Name: Richard Rogers
Notes: Rogers, a gay man, was convicted of two murders and implicated by forensics in two others. He was also suspected of murdering two other men, and was charged but acquitted for murdering a college student in 1973.

Name: Rabidin Satir
Notes: Nicknamed "Rambo Bentong". Rabidin had raped and murdered a 17-year-old schoolgirl Annie Kok Yin Cheng in March 2009 and battered 31-year-old forestry department employee Khairul Hazri Jamaludin to death in November 2012. Rabidin was convicted of both these murders and given two death sentences in 2014 and 2015 respectively. Rabidin was suspected of killing three to four more people: a nine-year-old girl, an elderly married couple in their 70s and a 63-year-old man between 2010 and 2012.

Name: Castration serial murders
Notes: Unidentified perpetrator who kidnapped young men, castrated them and shot them in the back of the head. Forensics proved at least two of the victims were killed by the same person.

Name: Steven Brian Pennell
Notes: Known as "The Corridor Killer" and "The Route 40 Killer"; convicted of torture-murdering two women, pleaded no contest to two more and suspected of a fifth in Delaware in 1987 and 1988. Executed by lethal injection March 14, 1992.

Name: Glen Rogers
Notes: His capture in Kentucky ended a nationwide manhunt that began with the "Cross-Country Killer's" crime spree that stretched from coast to coast and left four women and one man from five different states dead. Rogers was convicted and sentenced to death by electric chair in Florida in 1997 for the stabbing death of Tina Marie Cribbs. He was later convicted and given a second death penalty in California for the September 1995 murder of Sandra Gallagher. Also known as the "Casanova Killer", Rogers is the lone suspect in the stabbing deaths of two other women (Linda Price in Jackson, Mississippi and Andy Jiles Sutton in Bossier City, Louisiana), both of whom—like Cribbs and Gallagher—he'd met and befriended in bars. The earliest homicide Rogers is suspected of is that of an elderly Ohio man, Mark Peters, with whom Rogers had lived for a short time. In 1994, Peters' remains were discovered in a Rogers "family cabin" in Kentucky.[397]

Name: Mary Elizabeth Wilson
Notes: "The Merry Widow of Windy Nook". Believed to have poisoned her four husbands in a period of only two years. Sentenced to death for two murders but changed to life in prison, where she died in 1963.

Name: Bradley Edwards
Notes: Murders of two young women and the disappearance of a third in 1996 and 1997.

Name: Hadden Clark
Notes: Killed and cannibalized a 6-year-old victim and a 23-year-old victim, and confessed to the murder of an unidentified woman nicknamed Lady of the Dunes.

Name: Gary M. Heidnik
Notes: Kidnapped, tortured, raped and imprisoned six women in his Philadelphia, Pennsylvania basement, killing two.

Name: Ronny Rieken
Notes: Raped and killed two girls ages 11 and 13. He was caught as a result of mass DNA screening and sentenced to life imprisonment.

Name: Johann Otto Hoch
Country: United States  Austria (alleged)  France (alleged)  United Kingdom (alleged)
Notes: Swindler who married several women under different aliases, most of whom died after a few months; others disappeared without a trace. Convicted of one murder by poisoning and hanged.

Name: Carl Großmann
Notes: Known as "The Berlin Butcher". Killed women and sold their flesh on the black market. Only one body found. Hanged himself in his cell after being sentenced to death.[398]

Name: Sailson Jose das Gracas
Notes: Claims to have murdered 41 people in a nine-year killing spree that started at the age of 17.[399]

Name: Bobby Jack Fowler
Notes: One murder proven, suspected of up to 20 more. Suspect in the Highway of Tears murders.[400]

Name: Leszek Pękalski
Notes: Called "The Vampire of Bytów". Charged with 17 murders but convicted of only one (to 25 years in prison) for faulty collection of evidence. During the investigation he admitted to killing 80 people but later retracted his confession.

Name: Daniel Conahan
Notes: Convicted of one murder and has been linked to over a dozen murders.

Name: Tillie Klimek
Notes: Chicago woman who poisoned her husbands; only convicted of the murder of her third husband. Sentenced to life imprisonment.

Name: Lyda Southard
Notes: Suspected of killing her brother-in-law, four husbands and a daughter, but was only convicted of killing her fourth husband, Edward Meyer.

Name: John Norman Collins
Notes: Convicted of the murder of Karen Sue Beineman, suspected in the murder of at least five other young women in the vicinity of Ann Arbor and Ypsilanti, Michigan.

Name: Velma Barfield
Notes: Confessed to five poisonings with arsenic but was only tried and convicted for one. First woman to be executed in the United States after the 1976 resumption of capital punishment, receiving lethal injection in 1984.

Name: Raymond Morris
Notes: Known as the "A34 Killer"; convicted of one murder, considered to have committed at least two more.

Name: Robert Anthony Buell
Notes: Sentenced to death for the murder of a young girl and chief suspect in the murders of two others. Executed by lethal injection in 2002.

Name: Hensley Anthony Neville
Notes: A Singaporean sentenced to death for the 1984 rape and murder of a 19-year-old interior engineer in Singapore and chief suspect of a 1986 double murder in Malaysia. Executed by hanging on 28 August 1992.

Name: Harold Shipman
Notes: Convicted of 15 murders and found to be responsible for the deaths of 218 patients identified by inquiry, but is believed to have killed around 250 people.[402][403] He injected diamorphine into his patients and then falsified the medical records, reporting that his patient had been in poor health. Hanged himself in prison in 2004.

Name: Steven Massof
Notes: Massof, who worked at Kermit Gosnell's abortion clinic, testified that he snipped the spines of more than 100 babies after seeing them show signs of life.[404][405]

Name: Niels Högel
Notes: Nurse who was sentenced to life imprisonment for the murder of more than 85 people.[407][408] In November 2017, German prosecutors said that the number of victims was at least 106,[409] with Högel admitting, in October 2018, to murdering 100 patients.[14] By May 2019, he was believed to be the most prolific serial killer in peacetime Germany with up to 300 victims over fifteen years.[406]

Name: Baba Anujka
Notes: Anujka was an accomplished amateur chemist from the village of Vladimirovac, Yugoslavia (modern day Serbia). She poisoned at least 50 people and possibly as many as 150 in the late 19th and early 20th centuries. Was sentenced to 15 years in prison in 1929 but released after eight years due to old age.[410]

Name: Kermit Gosnell
Notes: Kermit Gosnell is an American serial-killer and former physician who ran an abortion clinic known as the "House of Horrors." Authorities discovered the remains of at least 47 late-term aborted children stored in bags or cartons, several of which appeared to be killed after birth. He was convicted in 2011 for 3 counts of first-degree murder of babies he delivered alive and then severed the spinal cords of, 1 count of manslaughter for the death of a woman he performed an abortion on, and over 200 counts of other abortion-related laws. Testimony indicated hundreds of similar procedures carried out by Gosnell and his staff.[413]

Name: Louay Omar Mohammed al-Taei
Notes: Medical doctor found to have killed 43 wounded policemen, soldiers and officials in Kirkuk; was a member of an insurgent cell.[414]

Name: Donald Harvey
Notes: Self-professed Angel of Death. Worked as an orderly in Cincinnati-area hospitals and preyed on his patients. Claimed to have killed 87 patients starting at age 18. Active 1970–1987. Sentenced to 28 life sentences in Ohio.[415]

Name: Jane Toppan
Notes: Nurse that confessed to poisoning 31 patients. Found not guilty by reason of insanity and interned in a mental institution until her death in 1938.[416]

Name: Charles Cullen
Notes: Nurse in New Jersey and Pennsylvania who murdered at least 29 patients between 1988 and 2003, but experts believe the number could be as high as 400. Cullen has admitted to more murders, which authorities believe are likely, but the murders cannot be verified due to lack of records.[417]

Name: Stephan Letter
Notes: Nurse who killed 29 patients; sentenced to life imprisonment in 2006.[418]

Name: Anders Hansson
Notes: A Nurse Aide who poisoned victims with gevisol and ivisol. His actions were called "The Hospital Murders" (Swedish: Sjukhusmorden).[419]

Name: Marcel Petiot
Notes: Active 1926 and from 1942 to 1944. Petiot is suspected of having killed up to 63 in total. Executed in 1946.[420]

Name: Arnfinn Nesset
Notes: Norwegian nurse and most prolific known serial killer in Scandinavian history, convicted in 1983 of poisoning at least 22 patients with Curacit; however he initially confessed to 27 murders; later he retracted his confessions and claimed he had killed 138 patients. Was released from prison in 2004 after serving 21 years, the maximum punishment possible by Norwegian law.[421]

Name: Roger Andermatt
Notes: Known as the "Death-Keeper of Lucerne"; nurse who killed 22 patients; most prolific Swiss serial killer in history; sentenced to life imprisonment.[422]

Name: Linda Hazzard
Notes: Quack doctor and swindler who manipulated her patients into fasting until they starved themselves to death. 17 deaths were attributed to this practice, with evidence of 15 being presented at her trial. She was pardoned after serving two years imprisonment with hard labour and later starved herself to death attempting her own fasting cure.

Name: Maxim Petrov
Notes: Doctor who killed his patients in St. Petersburg. Suspected of 19 murders.[423]

Name: Joan Vila
Notes: Nursing home worker who fatally poisoned 11 elderly residents or more in Olot. In the trial he claimed they were mercy kills intended to spare the victims of further suffering, although three of them were administered caustic cleaning materials that caused severe burns and a long agony.[425]

Name: Vickie Dawn Jackson
Notes: Vocational nurse at Nocona General Hospital who murdered patients who irritated her with injections of Mivacron. She was convicted of 10 murders, although law enforcement suspected her in around 20 suspicious deaths.

Name: Ann Arbor Hospital Killer
Notes: Poisonings of 10 patients at the Veteran's Administration Hospital in 1975. Filipino nurses Filipina Narciso and Leonora Perez were tried for the crimes.[426]

Name: Ludivine Chambet
Notes: Known as "The Poisoner of Chambéry"; nurse's aide who poisoned elderly patients; sentenced to 25 years imprisonment.[427]

Name: Frederick Mors
Notes: Born Carl Menarik, Austrian who killed 8 elderly patients by poisoning in New York. Sent to an asylum and escaped. Never caught.

Name: Elizabeth Wettlaufer
Notes: Confessed to murdering eight senior citizens and attempting to murder six others in southwestern Ontario.[428] With a total of fourteen victims either killed or injured by her actions, she is described as one of the worst serial killers in Canadian history.[429]

Name: Petr Zelenka
Notes: Killed his victims with a lethal injection of heparin from May to September 2006. Ten people survived his murder attempt. Suspected of up to 14 additional murders.

Name: Marianne Nölle
Notes: Nurse who was convicted of killing seven patients between 1984 and 1992; suspected of killing 17; sentenced to life imprisonment in 1993.[431]

Name: Lucy Letby
Notes: Nurse convicted of murdering seven babies and attempting to murder another six while working at Countess of Chester Hospital in Chester, England.[432]

Name: Orville Lynn Majors
Notes: LPN in Vermillion County Ind., Preyed on elderly patients—thought to have killed many of them with injections of potassium chloride. Sentenced to 360 years in Indiana.[433]

Name: Efren Saldivar
Notes: Respiratory therapist who killed six patients, possibly as many as 120.[434]

Name: Christine Malèvre
Notes: Nurse who killed terminally ill patients claiming that they had asked her to help them die, something denied by their families. Sentenced to 12 years in prison for six murders and suspect of 30.[435]

Name: Antoinette Scieri
Notes: Nurse who poisoned her elderly patients. Death sentence was commuted to life in prison and she died in prison.[436]

Name: Ahmad Ahmadi
Notes: Responsible for killing political prisoners at Qasr prison during the reign of Reza Shah.

Name: Kristen Gilbert
Notes: Nurse at a Massachusetts Veterans Medical Center who injected male patients with epinephrine, causing heart attacks. Sentenced to life without parole.[437]

Name: Frans Hooijmaijers
Notes: Nurse who was convicted for killing five patients at a hospital in Kerkrade, the Netherlands from 1970 to 1975, but was suspected to have killed approximately 259 people.

Name: Miyuki Ishikawa
Notes: Killed 84 newborn children at maximum. As a midwife, she killed infants born to parents unwilling to care for them during the prohibition of abortion in Japan.[438] Arrested in 1948, and sentenced to four years imprisonment in 1953 as final decision.[439]

Name: Amy Archer-Gilligan
Notes: A nursing home proprietor believed to have poisoned as many as 60 patients from her homes and her second husband. Charged with five murders originally, this was lowered to just one following her admission of guilt, and was found guilty of second degree murder. Died in a mental hospital in 1962.[440]

Name: Sonya Caleffi
Notes: Nurse who poisoned terminally-ill patients; sentenced to 20 years imprisonment.[441]

Name: Aino Nykopp-Koski
Notes: Nurse who killed five elderly patients using sedatives and opiates in Finland.

Name: Kimberly Clark Saenz
Notes: Killed five patients by using syringes to inject bleach into their dialysis lines.

Name: Michael Swango
Notes: Medical Doctor who killed patients.[442]

Name: Edson Izidoro Guimarães
Notes: Nurse who injected patients with potassium chloride or removed their oxygen mask. Confessed to five murders which he claimed to be mercy killings and was convicted of four in 2000; sentenced to 76 years in prison. He may have killed as many as 131 patients for money, as he was paid $60 for informing local funeral homes of a patient's death so that they could contact the deceased's relatives first.[443]

Name: Richard Angelo
Notes: Known as "The Angel of Death". New York nurse convicted of four murders, linked to six other deaths. Suspected of killing up to 25 people.[444]

Name: Colin Norris
Notes: Convicted of murdering four elderly women and attempting to murder another in two Leeds hospitals during 2002 while working as a nurse. He had injected the women, who were only in hospital due to broken hips, with massive overdoses of insulin. He was sentenced to life imprisonment with a minimum term of 30 years in 2008.[445]

Name: Beverley Allitt
Notes: Convicted of murdering four children and attacking another six in the Lincolnshire hospital where she worked as a nurse. Given 13 life sentences.[446]

Name: Abraao Jose Bueno
Notes: Nurse who injected young children with sedatives until they stopped breathing. He would then alert doctors in an attempt to earn the respect of his colleagues for being the first one to notice that something was wrong. Convicted of 4 deaths and 4 more murder attempts to 110 years in prison.

Name: Andrés Ulises Castillo Villarreal
Notes: Known as "The Chihuahua Ripper"; drugged, raped and then killed men in Chihuahua; sentenced to 120 years imprisonment.[447]

Name: Elfriede Blauensteiner
Notes: Known as "The Black Widow"; poisoned people for material gain; died from a brain tumor in 2003.[448]

Name: Genene Jones
Notes: Nurse convicted of murdering two infants via lethal injection. Accused of up to 60 murders.

Name: Benjamin Geen
Notes: Nurse convicted in 2006 of murdering two patients and causing grievous bodily harm to another 15 at Horton General Hospital in Banbury, Oxfordshire between 2003 and 2004.[449] Induced illness in the patients with overdoses of drugs, in order to enjoy the 'thrill' of resuscitating them.[450] Given 17 life sentences and ordered to serve at least 30 years imprisonment.[451] 9 other cases were originally investigated.[450]

Name: Marie Fikáčková
Notes: Nurse who was executed by hanging in 1961 for murdering babies.

Name: Victorino Chua
Notes: Poisoned several patients at Stepping Hill Hospital with insulin.

Name: Christopher Duntsch
Notes: Neurosurgeon known as "Dr. Death"; injured 33 out of 38 patients in two years resulting in two deaths.

Name: Felícitas Sánchez Aguillón
Notes: Known as "The Ogress of Roma neighborhood"; Nurse, midwife and baby farmer responsible for an unknown number of murders number during the 1930s, maybe 50 victims, in Mexico City.

Name: Robert George Clements
Notes: Believed to have murdered his four wives, all of whom died young and had their death certificates signed by Clements himself. Clements committed suicide with a morphine overdose when police came to arrest him for the murder of his fourth wife, who had died of the same cause.

Name: Murder Incorporated
Notes: Murder Incorporated or Murder Inc. for short was a large criminal enterprise of small contract-killing groups that were collectively known as Murder Inc. Run by Albert "The Mad Hatter" Anastasia and his close associates, the organization was responsible for the assassinations of key witnesses of early Cosa Nostra activities, so as to make them 'disappear' and break the case against the lead mobsters whenever they went to trial. In 1941 the group was exposed by former member Abe "Kid Twist" Reles and subsequently ceased to exist.

Name: Philadelphia poison ring
Notes: Gang of 16 that poisoned Italian immigrants with arsenic in order to collect their life insurance. The leaders, cousins Herman and Paul Petrillo, were executed in the electric chair in 1941 while the rest were given life sentences.[452]

Name: Abboud and Khajawa
Notes: Married couple who resorted to cannibalism during a famine in Mosul. They would use their young son to lure children into their home before beating them to death, dismembering them and eating their remains or serving them to members of the public at their restaurant. They also killed and ate one adult neighbour but found that her body contained too much fat.[453]

Name: Delfina and María de Jesús González
Notes: Two sisters who ran a brothel in Mexico, hired numerous sex workers and murdered at least 80 of them after they were deemed useless during the span of 10 years. They also killed 11 men. Probably the work of four of the sisters, sentenced to 40 years in prison. Body count varies due to the combined work of the sisters being impossible to assign to them individually.[28]

Name: Peng Miaoji, Ding Yunjia and Su Xiaoping
Notes: Fleeing to Shaanxi, Jiangsu, Anhui, and Henan provinces and 21 provinces and cities 33 administrative villages; during 38 burglaries, killed 77 people, seriously injured three others.[454][455]

Name: David Avendaño Ballina and his followers
Notes: Sex servant gang who robbed and then poisoned their clients; the leader Ballina was arrested in 2008.[456]

Name: Hassan Orangi and Abbas Ali Zarifian
Notes: Raped and murdered 62 women in Mashhad from 1945 to 1951. After his arrest, Orangi was tried, convicted, sentenced to death and later executed, while Zarifian was sentenced to 15 years for his role in the crimes.

Name: Angel Makers of Nagyrév
Notes: 26 women who poisoned their husbands (sometimes also their parents, lovers and children) with arsenic under the guidance of midwife Júlia Fazekas and her accomplice, Susi Oláh.[457]

Name: Long Zhimin and Yan Shuxia
Notes: Shaanxi Province Wang Shou villagers Long Zhimin and Yan Shuxia in the home has killed 48 people.[458]

Name: Bian Kuang, Fu Xinyuan and Luo Lianshun
Notes: Manufacturing 51 cases of murder, robbery, rape, killing 41 people. Bian Kuang personally killed 39 people.[459]

Name: Ivanova and Olga Tamarin
Notes: A mother and daughter who used accomplices to lure victims to their home. Tortured, murdered, and cannibalized at least 40 people before they were apprehended.[460]

Name: Ryno-Skachevsky gang
Notes: Racist skinhead gang, led by Artur Ryno and Pavel Skachevsky, who killed people from non-European ethnicities or backgrounds; both sentenced to 10 years of penal labour.[461]

Name: Gang of Amazons
Notes: Family of robbers and serial killers, led by the parents Inessa Tarverdiyeva and Roman Podkopaev.[462]

Name: Dean Corll, David Owen Brooks and Elmer Wayne Henley
Notes: Corll, known as "The Candy Man", killed at least 28 teenage boys and young men in Houston between 1970 and 1973. Corll was then shot and killed by one of the two teenage accomplices he recruited to assist him in the abductions of the victims on 8 August 1973. This accomplice, Elmer Wayne Henley, informed the police of the trio's murders the same day Corll was murdered.[463][464]

Name: Brabant killers
Notes: Gang made up by at least three extremely violent robbers, none of whom was ever identified or apprehended. Their bloodlust increased dramatically in their last year of activity, when they began shooting passersby before a robbery, including children, for no seeming reason. Some have theorized links to Operation Gladio.[465]

Name: Adolfo Constanzo and Sara Aldrete
Notes: "The Godparents of Matamoros". Leader and second-in-command of a drug-smuggling cult that abducted men to perform human sacrifices.[466]

Name: Shankill Butchers
Notes: Ulster Loyalist gang led by Lenny Murphy, who killed people in sectarian attacks.[467]

Name: Viktor Sayenko and Igor Suprunyuk
Notes: "The Dnepropetrovsk Maniacs". A pair of 19-year-olds who, over the course of less than a month, attacked and murdered passersby while out on walks. They recorded videos of some of the murders, including one which subsequently leaked to the Internet.[468]

Name: Marcelo de Jesus Silva and his death squad
Notes: Brazilian man convicted of 20 counts of murder, robbery, drug trafficking and death squad. As he was only 1.28m tall, he was nicknamed Chucky and Pigmeu. Murdered in 2010 by rivals traffickers.

Name: Wang Zongfang and Wang Zongwei
Notes: Killed soldiers using various arms in three provinces. Executed in 1983.[469]

Name: Anísio Ferreira de Sousa and followers
Notes: Satanic ring that abducted, mutilated and sacrificed children in Altamira, Brazil. The leader, Ferreira de Sousa, was convicted to 77 years in prison for four murders and two attempted murders.[470]

Name: Ripper Crew
Notes: Abducted women, mostly sex workers, then raped, tortured and killed them in Chicago, Illinois.[471]

Name: John Allen Muhammad and Lee Boyd Malvo
Notes: Killed seventeen people from February to September 2002 and 10 in the Beltway sniper attacks of October 2002. Muhammad was executed in 2009, while Malvo received life imprisonment.

Name: Vladyslav Volkovich and Volodymyr Kondratenko
Notes: "The Nighttime Killers". Murdered homeless men and lone drivers with a variety of weapons.[472]

Name: Death Angels
Notes: Four African-Americans who killed 16 white people and injured between eight and 10 in San Francisco (Zebra murders).[473]

Name: Lainz Angels of Death
Notes: Known as the "Lainz Angels of Death"; Waltraud Wagner, Irene Leidolf, Stephanija Mayer, and Maria Gruber were nurses at the Lainz General Hospital in Vienna who admitted to murdering 49 patients.[474]

Name: The Cleaners
Notes: Neo-Nazi gang, led by Pavel Voitov and Elena Lobacheva, who murdered alcoholic tramps and beggars; Voitov sentenced to life imprisonment and Lobacheva to 13 years in a penal colony.[475]

Name: José Miculax Bux and Mariano Macú Miculax
Notes: Cousins who killed 15 boys in 1946.

Name: Fred West and Rosemary West
Notes: Mainly targeted young women but were also found guilty of murdering two of their own daughters. Also found guilty of raping another daughter. Buried the victims around their house and local area of Gloucester. Shortly before he killed himself in 1995, Fred West said there were more victims.[476] At one point he confessed to killing up to 30.[477]

Name: Briley Brothers
Notes: Three brothers and an accomplice responsible for 12 murders in the 1970s in Richmond, Virginia.[478]

Name: John Justin Bunting, Robert Joe Wagner and James Spyridon Vlassakis
Notes: The bodies of eight victims were found in plastic barrels in a disused bank vault in Snowtown, South Australia. Bunting was found guilty of 11 murders, Wagner pleaded guilty to three and was convicted of a further seven murders.[479]

Name: Mailoni Brothers
Notes: Three brothers who killed at least 12 people from 2007 to 2013. Killed by Zambia Army Commandos in 2013.[480]

Name: Leonard Lake and Charles Ng
Notes: Abducted women, used them as sex slaves, and then murdered them, together with any men, women, and children who got in their way. Lake killed himself upon arrest, but Ng was later convicted of killing 11 people. Between 1982 and 1985, Lake and Ng were believed to have abducted and killed as many as 25 victims, as evidenced by human remains found on Lake's California ranch.[481]

Name: Bloody Benders
Notes: The Bender family, more well known as the Bloody Benders, were a family of serial killers in Labette County, Kansas, United States, from May 1871 to December 1872. Estimates report that the Benders killed at least a dozen travelers, and perhaps as many as twenty before they were discovered. The family's fate remains unknown, with theories ranging from a lynching to a successful escape.

Name: Shen Changyin and Shen Changping
Notes: Found guilty of the murders of 11 sex workers.[482] They were executed in 2006.[citation needed]

Name: Polatbay Berdaliyev and Abduseit Ormanov
Notes: Raped, robbed and murdered women along desolate roads; both sentenced to life imprisonment in both countries.[483]
